alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 8:59AM PDT until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following county, San Diego. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 AM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.4 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chula Vista, El Cajon, National City, La Mesa, Imperial Beach, Coronado, Alpine, Tierrasanta, North Park and Mission Valley. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
